question_content.barrons:question: Eager to set off on their ski trip, the boys packed up their gear and climbed into the van with ____________.
question_content.barrons:explanation:
expedition, alacrity.

The key word here is eager. Because the boys are eager to set off, they get ready with expedition (speedy promptness) or alacrity (briskness; cheerful willingness). Note the secondary meaning of expedition here.

Arrogance is incorrect. Arrogance means haughtiness or proud contempt. The noun makes no sense in the context.

Difficulty is incorrect. Nothing in the sentence suggests that the boys have any difficulty climbing into the van.

Prodigality is incorrect. Prodigality means wasteful extravagance. The noun makes no sense in the context.

Skepticism is incorrect. Skepticism means doubt or disbelief. The noun makes no sense in the context.
